metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8501 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The _bfd_XXi_swap_aouthdr_in function in bfd/peXXigen.c in GNU binutils 2.24 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds write) and possibly have other unspecified impact via a crafted NumberOfRvaAndSizes field in the AOUT header in a PE executable.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8501` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.24-5ubuntu3.1
binutils-multiarch - 2.24-5ubuntu3.1
binutils-source - 2.24-5ubuntu3.1
binutils-static - 2.24-5ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

gdb - 7.7.1-0ubuntu5~14.04.3
gdb-minimal - 7.7.1-0ubuntu5~14.04.3
gdb-multiarch - 7.7.1-0ubuntu5~14.04.3
gdb-source - 7.7.1-0ubuntu5~14.04.3
gdb64 - 7.7.1-0ubuntu5~14.04.3
gdbserver - 7.7.1-0ubuntu5~14.04.3
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> binutils USN description: Hanno Böck discovered that the _bfd_XXi_swap_aouthdr_in function in libbfd in GNU binutils allowed out-of-bounds writes. An attacker could use this to craft input that could cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

criterions.comment: binutils package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.24-5ubuntu3.1').
gdb package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.7.1-0ubuntu5~14.04.3').
